subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etyl}}
{{Han compound|自|t1=nose|畀|ls=psc|c1=s|c2=p}}. Originally written as {{och-l|自}}, before it was borrowed for the sense of “self”.

subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*bi||nose}}; compare {{cog|ii|ꅳꁖ|ꅳ'''ꁖ'''|nose; snot}}.

Alternatively, it may be from {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*s-brit||sneeze; nose; swallow}}, whence {{cog|bo|སྦྲིད||sneeze}}, but there is no trace of ''r'' in Chinese ({{zh-ref|Schuessler, 2007}}).

In some modern lects, including Mandarin, Gan, Jin, Wu and Xiang, and even in the literary layer of some Min dialects, the word reflects a form with final {{m|und|*-t}}. For example, in standard Mandarin, the word is pronounced ''bí'' (implying an old entering tone) instead of ''bì'' (the expected reflex from the departing tone in Middle Chinese). This is due to a phonological phenomenon in the northwest, either an early loss of {{m|und|*-s}} in the {{m|und|*-ts}} cluster before regular final cluster simplification occurred ({{zh-ref|Baxter, 1992}}), or a dialectal change from {{m|und|*-s}} to {{m|und|*-t}} ({{zh-ref|Pulleybank, 1998}}).

subSections.title: Pronunciation
subSections.text:
{{zh-pron
|m=bí
|m-s=bi2
|c=bei6
|c-t=bei5,bei5*
|c-t_note=bei5 - “nose”; bei5* - “nasal mucus”
|g=pit7
|h=pfs=phi;gd=pi4
|j=bieh5
|mb=pī/bī
|mb_note=pī - vernacular (noun); bī - vernacular (“to smell”)
|md=pé/bê/bĭk
|md_note=pé - vernacular (noun); bê - vernacular (“to smell”); bĭk - literary
|mn=xm,zz,tp,kh,tn,tc,hc,yl,mg:phīⁿ/ml,lk,sx,km,jj,ph:phī/lk:phǐ/xm,zz:pi̍t
|mn_note=phīⁿ/phī/phǐ - vernacular; pi̍t - literary
|mn-t=pin7
|w=5beq
|x=bi6
|mc=y
|oc=y
|cat=n,a,v
}}
